titleStmt.title: A dialogue, arguing that arch-bishops, bishops, curates, neuters, are to be cut-off by the law of God; therefore all these, with their service, are to be castout by the law of the land. Notwithstanding, the world pleads for their own, why some bishops should be spared; the government maintained; the name had in honour still; but the word of God is cleare against all this, for the casting-of-all-forth. The great question is, which way of government now? For two wayes are contended for, The Presbyteriall and Independent: something is said to both these wayes: but we have a sure word for it, that these two wayes are but in shew two, and will assuredly meet in one. Neuters are shewen openly here, and the curse of God upon them. Presented to the Assembly of Divines.
titleStmt.author: Woodward, Ezekias, 1590-1675.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by T. P. and M. S. in Gold-Smiths-Alley,

notesStmt.note: Anonymous. By Hezekiah Woodward -- Cf. Wing.
Annotation on Thomason copy: The "4" in the imprint date is crossed out; "Feb. 26: 1643".
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
